content: Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
author: Rumi

content: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
author: Carl Jung

content: All conditioned things are impermanent'—when one sees this with wisdom, one turns away from suffering. This is the path to purification.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: You have power over your mind – not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: What you seek is seeking you.
author: Rumi

content: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
author: Carl Jung

content: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier.
author: Mother Teresa (Stoic ideals)

content: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
author: Rumi

content: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
author: Carl Jung

content: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
author: Rumi

content: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
author: Carl Jung

content: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.
author: Rumi

content: We are not what happened to us, we are what we wish to become.
author: Carl Jung

content: If you propose to speak always be sure it is an improvement on silence.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

content: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
author: Rumi

content: Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
author: Carl Jung

content: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

content: You were born with potential. You were born with goodness and trust. You were born with ideals and dreams. You were born with greatness. You were born with wings. You are not meant for crawling, so don't. You have wings. Learn to use them and fly.
author: Rumi

content: The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are.
author: Carl Jung

content: Just as a solid rock is unshaken by the storm, even so the wise are unshaken by praise or blame.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: This is how I would die into the love I have for you: As pieces of cloud dissolve in sunlight.
author: Rumi

content: The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed.
author: Carl Jung

content: Your purpose in life is to find your purpose and give your whole heart and soul to it.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?
author: Epictetus

content: Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death.
author: Rumi

content: There is no coming to consciousness without pain.
author: Carl Jung

content: The root of suffering is attachment.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: The chief task in life is simply this: to identify and separate matters so that I can say clearly to myself which are externals not under my control, and which have to do with the choices I actually control.
author: Epictetus

content: Travel brings power and love back into your life.
author: Rumi

content: I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.
author: Carl Jung

content: What we think, we become.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: You are searching for treasure outside, but the real treasure is inside you.
author: Rumi

content: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
author: Carl Jung

content: The greatest wealth is contentment with little, for there is never want for those who are content.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: To live happily is an inward power of the soul.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Let go of your mind and then be mindful. Close your ears and listen.
author: Rumi

content: The shadow is a living part of the personality and therefore wants to live with it in some form. It cannot be argued with - it has to be lived with.
author: Carl Jung

content: If you let go a little, you will have a little peace. If you let go a lot, you will have a lot of peace.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: What hurts you, blesses you. Darkness is your candle.
author: Rumi

content: A dream is a theater where the dreamer is at once scene, player, prompter, stage manager, author, audience, and critic.
author: Carl Jung

content: Better than a meaningless word is a meaningful sentence, if one hears it and understands.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: No person has the power to have everything they want, but it is in their power not to want what they don't have, and to cheerfully put to good use what they do have.
author: Seneca

content: Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.
author: Rumi

content: The most terrifying thing is to accept oneself completely.
author: Carl Jung

content: Whatever words we utter should be chosen with care for people will hear them and be influenced by them for good or ill.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself amongst the insane.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Let the lover be disgraceful, crazy, absentminded. Someone sober will worry about events later, let the lover be insane.
author: Rumi

content: To conquer oneself is a greater task than conquering others.
author: Buddhist Philosophy

content: If you seek tranquillity, do less.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray.
author: Rumi

content: You were born with wings, why prefer to crawl through life?
author: Rumi

content: When the soul lies down in that grass, the world is too full to talk about ideas, language, even the phrase each other doesn't make any sense.
author: Rumi

content: Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.
author: Rumi

content: Try not to resist the changes that come your way. Instead, let life live through you. And do not worry that your life is turning upside down. How do you know that the side you are used to is better than the one to come?
author: Rumi

content: Do not feel lonely, the entire universe is inside you.
author: Rumi

content: The moment you accept what troubles you've been given, the door will open.
author: Rumi

content: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
author: Steve Maraboli

content: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

content: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: The greatest motivation you can give yourself is to enjoy what you do.
author: Anonymous

content: Your limitation—it's only your imagination.
author: Anonymous

content: Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
author: Anonymous

content: Sometimes later becomes never. Do it now.
author: Anonymous

content: Great things never come from comfort zones.
author: Anonymous

content: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

content: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

content: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

content: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

content: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

content: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

content: It is not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves.
author: Edmund Hillary

content: Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
author: Rumi

content: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
author: Pablo Picasso

content: Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms—to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances.
author: Viktor Frankl

content: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

content: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
author: Mark Twain

content: When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
author: Lao Tzu

content: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise. Seek what they sought.
author: Matsuo Basho

content: External things are not the problem. It's your assessment of them. Which you can erase right now.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
author: Lao Tzu

content: The more you are motivated by love, the more fearless and free your action will be.
author: Dalai Lama

content: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anaïs Nin

content: Every worthy act is difficult. Ascent is always difficult. Descent is easy and often slippery.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: I have been impressed with the urgency of doing. Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Being willing is not enough; we must do.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

content: The only limits you see are the ones you impose on yourself.
author: Dr. Wayne Dyer

content: What you seek is seeking you.
author: Rumi

content: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
author: Rumi

content: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

content: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

content: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

content: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

content: You do not rise to the level of your goals. You fall to the level of your systems.
author: James Clear

content: Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
author: George Bernard Shaw

content: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

content: The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
author: Ram Dass

content: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

content: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think.
author: Socrates

content: A man who fears suffering is already suffering from what he fears.
author: Michel de Montaigne

content: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

content: We are not given a good life or a bad life. We are given a life. It's up to us to make it good or bad.
author: Ward Foley

content: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
author: Confucius

content: If we are facing in the right direction, all we have to do is keep on walking.
author: Buddhist Proverb

content: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing, there is a field. I'll meet you there.
author: Rumi

content: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
author: Socrates

content: The cave you fear to enter holds the treasure you seek.
author: Joseph Campbell

content: The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.
author: St. Augustine

content: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
author: Rumi

content: The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness.
author: Lao Tzu

content: You have power over your mind – not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius
